pullRequest.body:
Adds the geometric probability distribution

---

nodes.body:
The `p ∈ Ioc 0 1` hypotheses look strange. Why not `(hp_pos : 0 < p) (hp_le_one : p <= 1)`?
It looks like you have to turn the Ioc hypothesis back into simple inequalities several times to then use `positivity`, so there is a drawback to using Ioc. Also, to provide a `p ∈ Ioc 0 1` term to one of your lemmas, you would basically have to put both inequalities into a constructor, while you could just as easily have provided the inequalities separately.
What made you use Ioc?
No particular reason, I just wanted to reduce the number of hypotheses, so Ioc uses one less hypothesis. however, I agree that it is quite clumsy. Shall I rewrite in terms of your hypotheses?
Yes, please use two separate hypotheses.
I've made the necessary changes. Perhaps `measurable_geometricPmfReal` (line 65) is redundant now, as the proof is literally `by measurability`?

:v: JADekker can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

@RemyDegenne I've just made a new commit with your suggested changes AND name style changes consistent with the PR #9681 that you also accepted. I just wanted to check in that this was fine before merging?
It looks good! You can merge when CI succeeds.
bors r+

```suggestion
lemma geometricPmfReal_nonneg {p : ℝ} {n : ℕ} (hp_pos : 0 < p) (hp_le_one : p <= 1) :
```

This is used everywhere below and could be deleted from all lemma statements:
```suggestion

variable {p : ℝ}

```
